page.title: 15LOCAL HISTORY HOLT WORCS
page.content: { {Bronze-age barrow cemetery}near lane leading to Church and Castle. 5 urn cremations discovered 1971.Aerial evidence of continuous pre-historic and Romano-British settlement on gravel terrace now being quarried. Saxon name "Holt" ( a wood) remains unchanged.Manor of Holt granted by William I to Urse D'Abitot who built Castle in 1072 as defence against Welsh raiders. Wild and wooded character of the area kept as an aid to defence until cultivated in 16th century. {CHURCH }contempory with Castle with some later additions. Old centres of population near Church and once important river became less important after opening of bridge in 1828. The area near the cross-roads at Holt Heath is now the most populous part.
